Medium: Glass, greenish; blown, folded foot; enameled and gilded
Heilbrunn Timeline of Art History: The Art of the Mamluk Period (1250–1517)
Description: The size and delicate decoration of this bottle are remarkable; few such large or painterly examples of enameled glass are known. The polychrome phoenix on the neck soars above the central scene of mounted warriors wielding maces, swords, and bows. The warriors might well be participants in a horsemanship exercise, outfitted as combatants from the rival Ilkhanid and Mamluk states.
